𝑑𝜎 𝑑𝑡 • But for capacitor plates, 𝐸 = 𝜎 𝜀0 • So 𝐽𝐷 = 𝜀0 𝜕𝐸 𝜕𝑡 This is known as the Displacement Current Density • It’s not a current, it’s a changing electric field but has the same effect as a current i.e. produces B-field. 9 Ampere-Maxwell Law • Ampere’s law needs to be modified to take the displacement current into account: • Ampere-Maxwell Law ׯ 𝑩 ∙ 𝑑𝒍 = 𝜇0 ׬𝑆 𝑱 + 𝜀0 𝜕𝑬 𝜕𝑡 ∙ 𝑑𝒔 10
